meanings.definition: The act of placing a load or cargo on a vehicle or ship.
meanings.sent1: The loading of boxes onto the truck was hard work.
meanings.sent2: The loading of goods onto the ship took hours.
meanings.sent3: The loading of the tiny car with giant watermelons was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a loading dock, constantly receiving new information.
meanings.sent5: The loading of the heavy crates onto the plane was a memorable experience.

meanings.definition: The process of preparing a computer program for execution.
meanings.sent1: The loading of the software onto the computer was quick.
meanings.sent2: The loading of the game took longer than expected.
meanings.sent3: The loading of the program seemed to make the computer dance.
meanings.sent4: His brain felt like a loading bar, slowly processing each thought.
meanings.sent5: The loading of the website was so slow, it felt like watching paint dry.

meanings.definition: The amount of work or stress placed on a person or system.
meanings.sent1: The loading of responsibilities on her shoulders was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: The loading of tasks on the team caused tension.
meanings.sent3: The loading of chores on the robot made it malfunction comically.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like a loading gauge, showing the pressure he was under.
meanings.sent5: The loading of deadlines on him made each day feel like a race against time.
